Class Homogenous

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Graph
        |
        +--Homogenous
public class Homogenous
extends Graph

This Class creates Homogenous graphs and provides a checking method in order to check whether our graph topology is correct or not.

Constructor Detail

Homogenous

public Homogenous(int numOfVertices)
Initialize Homogenous graph with argument the number Of Vertices.
The algorithm works as follows:
1. Start with N vertices and no edges
2. Connect each vertex with all of the other vertices

           throws java.io.IOException

printTopology

public void printTopology(int numOfVertices,
                          java.lang.String topologyFilePath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Prints Graph Topology on a text file and is stored in the classpath defined by the topologyFilePath argument.
The integer argument numOfVertices is the number of vertices/nodes of the graph.

java.io.IOException
